HS_Presentation:
Hello, my name is Aloys Demagnée, I am a Game Programmer always looking for new challenges.

Welcome to my Portfolio!
HS_Team_Quote: « None of us acting alone can achieve success »
SP_WD_Pitch:
Withering Depths is a 2D platformer built around an imposed theme "Unfair". Its gameplay mixes both puzzle and platforming elements.
This is the first long-term project I completed. Developed in Unity using C#, it allowed me to learn both the engine and the language.
Thanks to this project, I discovered the production pipeline of a game, from its conception to its completion.
SP_Modulo_Pitch:
Modulo is a Tower Defense game, that puts the player's adaptability and strategy to the test against waves of enemies growing in strength and number.
This Unity project, made in C#, allowed me to learn some key concepts of object-oriented programming while strengthening my knowledge in this field.
SP_Munir_Pitch:
Munir is a 3D Puzzle-Adventure game combining puzzle phases and haptic challenges in a dreamlike universe inspired by the the mythologies of the Arab world.
Through this first 3D project, I discovered the basics of tooling and worked on custom physics programming through an atypical controller. I also learned to work in a larger team and therefore to delegate tasks.
PP_Avaiki_Pitch:
The Trial of Avaiki is a competitive online deck-building game, using peer-to-peer technology. A round is divided into two phases :
A Preparation phase, where the player organizes their board by buying and merging cards.
A combat phase where they face their opponent in turn-based fights.
AM_Presentation_Text: Hello, my name is Aloys and I am 20 years old and am currently studying game programming at Rubika Valenciennes(France). My passion for coding started at the age of 12 with Scratch, a visual programming language that taught me the basics of programming. Since then, I have constantly experimented with new programs, some more concrete than others.
Passion_Text: What I enjoy in programming is turning complex problems into simple solutions, while aiming for a clean and polished project. In my opinion, a good programmer is someone who remains curious and in constant learning.
Why_Text: Because I have always loved to dive into universes and tell immersive stories. A game like "Five Nights at Freddy's", which I've followed since my childhood, has always amazed me with its ability to tell stories by hiding the essentials in the details and its atmosphere.
